param.name: region
param.label: Region of the genome to limit the operation
param.help: The format is chr:start-end. Also valid is just to specify a chromosome, for example chr10:10-500

param.name: used_multiple_regions_options
param.label: Did you compute the matrix with more than one groups of regions?
param.help: Would you like to cluster the regions according to the similarity of the signal distribution? This is only possible if you used computeMatrix on only one group of regions.
param.option: Yes, I used multiple groups of regions
No, I used only one group

param.name: k_kmeans
param.label: Number of clusters to compute
param.help: When this option is set, then the matrix is split into clusters using the kmeans algorithm. Only works for data that is not grouped, otherwise only the first group will be clustered. If more specific clustering methods are required it is advisable to save the underlying matrix and run the clustering using other software. The plotting of the clustering may fail (Error: Segmentation fault) if a cluster has very few members compared to the total number or regions. (default: None).

param.name: samFlag
param.label: Filter reads based on the SAM flag
param.help: For example to get only reads that are the first mate use a flag of 64. This is useful to count properly paired reads only once, otherwise the second mate will be also considered for the coverage. (--samFlag)

param.name: plotNumbers
param.label: Plot the correlation value
param.help: If set, then the correlation number is plotted on top of the heatmap. (--plotNumbers)

param.name: doNotExtendPairedEnds
param.label: Do not extend paired ends
param.help: If set, reads are not extended to match the fragment length reported in the BAM file, instead they will be extended to match the fragment length. Default is to extend the reads if paired end information is available. (--doNotExtendPairedEnds)

param.name: ignoreDuplicates
param.label: Ignore duplicates
param.help: If set, reads that have the same orientation and start position will be considered only once. If reads are paired, the mate position also has to coincide to ignore a read. (--ignoreDuplicates)

param.label: Minimum mapping quality
param.help: If set, only reads that have a mapping quality score higher than the given value are considered. *Note* Bowtie's Mapping quality is related to uniqueness: the higher the score, the more unique is a read. A mapping quality defined by Bowtie of 10 or less indicates that there is at least a 1 in 10 chance that the read truly originated elsewhere.

param.name: skipZeros
param.label: Skip zeros
param.help: If set, then zero counts that happen for *all* BAM files given are ignored. This might have the effect that fewer regions are considered than indicated in the option where the number of samples is defined. (--skipZeros)

param.name: fragmentLength
param.label: Fragment length used for the sequencing
param.help: If paired-end reads are used, the fragment length is computed from the BAM file. (--fragmentLength)

param.name: xMax
param.label: Max value for the x-axis in counts per bin

param.name: filterThreshold_low
param.label: Remove bins of low coverage
param.help: e.g. -1.5; Both Thresholds needs to be set to take effect.

param.name: filterThreshold_large
param.label: Remove bins of large coverage
param.help: e.g. 5; Both Thresholds needs to be set to take effect.

param.name: pseudocount
param.label: Pseudocount
param.help: Small number to avoid dividing by zero.

param.name: effectiveGenomeSize_opt
param.label: Effective genome size
param.help: The effective genome size is the portion of the genome that is mappable. Large fractions of the genome are stretches of NNNN that should be discarded. Also, if repetitive regions were not included in the mapping of reads, the effective genome size needs to be adjusted accordingly. See Table 2 of http://www.plosone.org/article/info%3Adoi%2F10.1371%2Fjournal.pone.0030377 or http://www.nature.com/nbt/journal/v27/n1/fig_tab/nbt.1518_T1.html for several effective genome sizes.

param.name: missingDataAsZero
param.label: Treat missing data as zero
param.help: This parameter determines if missing data should be treated as zeros. If unchecked, missing data will be ignored and not included in the output file. Missing data is defined as those regions for which both BAM files have 0 reads.
